entities.name: stitches
entities.description: Stitches are a medical term used to describe the process of sewing wounds back together. This is mentioned in the conversation between Harry and Mrs. Weasley.

entities.name: snake's venom
entities.description: The snake's venom is mentioned as the reason why stitches don't work on magical wounds. This is mentioned by Hermione in her explanation.

entities.name: tearoom
entities.description: Hermione asks where the tearoom is, indicating that it is a location they are trying to find.

entities.name: Mrs. Weasley
entities.description: Mrs. Weasley is mentioned as being present in the scene and reacting to Harry's comment about stitches.

entities.name: Arthur
entities.description: Arthur (presumably Mr. Weasley) is mentioned by Mrs. Weasley as someone who wouldn't be stupid enough to try to sew his skin back together.

entities.name: Harry
entities.description: Harry is the one who makes a comment about stitches and then gets up to get a cup of tea.

entities.name: Hermione
entities.description: Hermione explains how stitches work on non-magical wounds and asks where the tearoom is.

entities.name: Ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as being present in the scene and following Harry out of the room.

entities.name: Ginny
entities.description: Ginny is mentioned as being present in the scene and reacting to her father's comment about stitches.

relationships.description: Harry makes a comment about stitches, which leads to further discussion.
Hermione explains how the snake's venom affects stitches.
Ginny refers to her father, Arthur, in a negative light.
Mrs. Weasley reacts strongly to Harry's comment about stitches.
